meanings.definition: Treat (a substance) with heat to destroy or inhibit the growth of harmful microorganisms.
meanings.sent1: The chef was pasteurising the milk to make it safe for the customers.
meanings.sent2: The dairy industry often pasteurises milk to make it last longer.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria were surprised to find themselves pasteurised out of existence.
meanings.sent4: The heat was like a warrior, pasteurising all the germs in its path.
meanings.sent5: The process of pasteurising can be a lifesaver when it comes to food safety.

meanings.sent1: The factory workers were pasteurising the juice before packaging it.
meanings.sent2: It is important to pasteurise canned foods to prevent spoilage.
meanings.sent3: The fruit felt like a celebrity getting pasteurised before the big reveal.
meanings.sent4: The pasteurising machine hummed like a diligent worker, ensuring safety.
meanings.sent5: Pasteurising is a crucial step in food processing to ensure quality and safety.
